verb.description: Institute legal proceedings against (a person or organization)
examples: they were prosecuted for obstructing the highway

verb.description: Continue with (a course of action) with a view to its completion.
examples: a serious threat to the government's ability to prosecute the war

origin: Late Middle English (in prosecute (sense 2)): from Latin prosecut- pursued, accompanied, from the verb prosequi, from pro- onward + sequi follow.
